tp.pr4.control

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomComplicaPlayer, RandomConnect4Player, RandomGravityPlayer

    public interface Player
    Interface that represents a player; when the controller wants to know which move to execute next, it asks the player whose turn it is to provide a move. This is not a concept of the game (which receives the instructions of which move to execute), but rather of the control of the execution flow of the application, which is why it is in the control package rather than the logic package.
    Since:
    Assignment 3

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Move getMove(Board board, Counter colour)
      Returns the next move that this player is ready to execute.

    • Method Detail

      • getMove

        Move getMove(Board board,
           Counter colour)
        Returns the next move that this player is ready to execute. Different implementations can exhibit different behaviours if passed a board as first argument on which it is not possible to place a counter of the colour passed as second argument, such as return an incorrect movement or return null, etc.
        Parameters:
        board - The board on which to place the counter.
        colour - Colour of the counter to be placed on the board. This parameter facilitates the implementation of some derived classes but others, those for which the objects have been configured on construction, will not need to use it.
        Returns:
        Move to be executed. Depending on the implementation, the move may, or may not, be assumed correct.
